page.title: 15Wind-Surfing Club, Lound
page.content: At Lound there is a disused gravel pit where you can go wind-surfing. There has been a wind-surfing club there for five years. Before that it was used for water-skiing. The club opens every day at lO o'clock in the morning and closes at dusk. Between thirty and eighty people visit the lake each day. The weekends are busy. The water is between ten and twenty feet deep. There are a lot of fish in the lake, including some pike. You can have tuition which costs Â£lO.5O an hour. You are supplied with all the necessary equipment. They have a simulated board on land for beginners. They also have small boards and sails for children. After you have had your tuition they supply a board, sail and wet suit for Â£2.5O. They have a race night on Thursdays for the good wind-surfers.
